title: Package

adjectives: Easily damaged or requiring careful handling.
Easily broken or damaged or destroyed
Easily broken; mentally or physically fragile; not firm or durable; liable to fail and perish; easily destroyed; not tenacious of life; weak; infirm.
Easily broken or destroyed, and thus often of subtle or intricate structure.
Closed or secured with or as if with a seal
verbs: Change location; move, travel, or proceed, also metaphorically
To change (from one value to another).
To move or travel (from one location to another).
To change the location of an object.
To transfer a file from one location to another. After the file is transferred, there is only one copy of the file, in the new location.
To move an object one pixel at a time.
To send (a letter, parcel, etc.) through the mail.
nouns: The transportation of a group of people to a new settlement.
The transportation of people (as a family or colony) to a new settlement (as after an upheaval of some kind)
The transportation of a group of people to a new settlement
Resettlement in Newfoundland and Labrador terms was an organized approach to centralize the population into growth areas.
Process of vacating a fixed location
The process of vacating a fixed residence in favour of another
Relocation, also known as moving, is the process of vacating a fixed location and settling in a different one.
Material resembling heavy paper.
A stiff moderately thick paper
A generic term for a heavy-duty paper
A stiff kind of paper often made up of several layers.
A wood-based material resembling heavy paper, used in the manufacture of boxes, cartons and signs.

Cardboard is a generic term for a heavy-duty paper of various strengths, ranging from a simple arrangement of a single thick sheet of paper to complex configurations featuring multiple corrugated and uncorrugated layers.
Plural form of box.
A (usually rectangular) container; may have a lid
A cuboid space; a container, usually with a hinged lid.
Box describes a variety of containers and receptacles for permanent use as storage, or for temporary use often for transporting contents.
Or any of a variety of containers or receptacles
Encloses products for distribution, storage, sale, and use
A small amount of food that has been wrapped up, for example a pastry.
Enclosing or protecting products for distribution, storage, sale, and use
Packaging is the technology of enclosing or protecting products for distribution, storage, sale, and use.
A wrapped container
The mail or post is a system for physically transporting documents and other small packages, as well as a name for the postcards, letters, and parcels themselves.
The letters, parcels etc delivered to a particular address or person.
Anything sent through postal services

Mail, or post, is a system for transporting letters and other tangible objects: written documents, typically enclosed in envelopes, and also small packages are delivered to destinations around the world.
The system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office
A message or topic published on a blog, message board or Help board.
A single delivery of letters; the letters or deliveries that make up a single batch delivered to one person or one address.
Method of delivering mail.
System for transporting documents and other small packages
A batch of letters and parcels received via post.

description:
A package (parcel), as contains items ordered online. Depicted at various angles as a light-brown, cardboard box, with a shipping label and its top taped shut.

Commonly used for content concerning shipping, delivery, and moving as well as for boxes more generally.

Apple’s design features an image of a wine glass, indicating fragile contents, and “this way up” orientation arrows. It was briefly identical to its üéÅ Wrapped Gift.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the package emoji presents itself as a neatly tied cardboard box, rendered with a subtle gloss and realistic shadows that convey a sense of tangible presence. Its soft rounded edges and the gentle sheen of the tape suggest a secure and ready-to-be-opened delivery. This emoji on Apple devices is perfect for indicating shipments, gifts, or anything being sent or received.
